name: Seaside Jawari
description: This algorithm is based on the open source Jawari^89 VCV Rack module by Seaside Modular. It is a simulation of the tanpura, the Indian drone instrument. The tanpura is a four-stringed instrument, without frets. The four strings are typically played in sequence, in a continuos loop, and this is what this algorithm does. Each time it gets a strum (from the strum input bus, or via the strum parameter) it advances to and plays the next string. The second, third, and fourth strings of the tanpura are generally tuned in octaves, with the fourth string an octave below the other two. The first string is tuned to another note of the scale, very often the fifth. For a completely authentic sound, you might consider using the microtuning support to tune the strings to just intervals.

parameters.name: Bridge shape
parameters.description: Sets the blend between the raw string pluck and a comb filtered version.

parameters.name: Tuning (1st string)
parameters.description: Sets the tuning of the first string, in semitones above the fourth string.

parameters.name: Transpose
parameters.description: Transposes the whole instrument.

parameters.name: Fine tune
parameters.description: Fine tuning control for the whole instrument.

parameters.name: Strum
parameters.description: Causes a strum when changed from 0 to 1.

parameters.name: Reset
parameters.description: Resets the sequence so that the next strum plays the first string.

parameters.name: Velocity
parameters.description: Sets the strum velocity.

parameters.name: Damping
parameters.description: The damping factor for the string model.

parameters.name: Length
parameters.description: The decay time for the string model.

parameters.name: Bounce count
parameters.description: The number of bridge bounces after the initial strum.

parameters.name: Strum level
parameters.description: The relative strength of the strum vs the bounces.

parameters.name: Bounce level
parameters.description: The relative strength of the bounces vs the strum.

parameters.name: Start harmonic
parameters.description: The emphasised harmonic at the start of the bounces.

parameters.name: End harmonic
parameters.description: The emphasised harmonic at the end of the bounces.

parameters.name: Strum type
parameters.description: The shape of the initial strum applied to the string model: Flat or Ramped.

parameters.name: 0 11 7 Sets the tuning of the first string, in semitones above the fourth string. Transpose
parameters.description: Transposes the whole instrument.

parameters.name: first string. Velocity
parameters.description: Sets the strum velocity.

parameters.name: 1 10000 1200 The number of bridge bounces after the initial strum. Strum level
parameters.description: The relative strength of the strum vs the bounces.

parameters.name: bounces. End harmonic
parameters.description: The emphasised harmonic at the end of the bounces.

parameters.name: 0 28 0 The bus to use for CV control over the ‘bridge shape’. Reset
parameters.description: The bus to use for a reset trigger.

parameters.name: as a whole. V/oct 1st
parameters.description: The bus to use for pitch control over the tuning of

parameters.name: 0 11 7 Sets the tuning of the first string, in semitones above the fourth string. Transpose
parameters.description: Transposes the whole instrument.

parameters.name: first string. Velocity
parameters.description: Sets the strum velocity.

parameters.name: 1 10000 1200 The number of bridge bounces after the initial strum. Strum level
parameters.description: The relative strength of the strum vs the bounces.

parameters.name: bounces. End harmonic
parameters.description: The emphasised harmonic at the end of the bounces.

parameters.name: 0 28 0 The bus to use for CV control over the ‘bridge shape’. Reset
parameters.description: The bus to use for a reset trigger.

input_ports.name: Strum
input_ports.description: The bus to use for a strum trigger.

input_ports.name: Bridge shape
input_ports.description: The bus to use for CV control over the ‘bridge shape’.

input_ports.name: Reset
input_ports.description: The bus to use for a reset trigger.

input_ports.name: V/oct main
input_ports.description: The bus to use for pitch control over the instrument as a whole.

input_ports.name: V/oct 1st string
input_ports.description: The bus to use for pitch control over the tuning of the first string.

output_ports.name: Output mode
output_ports.description: The standard Add/Replace mode selector as described above.
